name: EdgeWord (Part I)
description:
This is the first in a series of katas about a letter-placement puzzle known as edgewords.

An Edgeword puzzle positions pairs of letters on  the outer 8 squares of a 3 x 3 grid to form four six-letter words.

For example, given the eight two-letter tiles

```LA - WN - MB - ZE - DA - RO - MA - ED```

We could lay them out in a square like this:

```
LA-MB-DA
MA    WN
ZE-RO-ED
```

This first kata in the series is simple.  Given a single six-letter word, write code which returns an array of two-letter sequences which can be combined to make up that word.

So, for example, the word

```BARBER```

would result in the array

```['BA','RB', 'ER']```, 

while

```CANARY```

would result in the array

```['CA', 'NA', 'RY']```

All words used in testing will give valid results, and all words are valid English words, so there's no need for any checking.
